src.training.utils package¶

Submodules¶

src.training.utils.callbacks module¶

Trainer callbacks for hub uploads, success caching, and replay buffer.

class src.training.utils.callbacks.PushToHubRevisionCallback(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: TrainerCallback

Callback that pushes a checkpoint to the hub under a step-specific tag.

get_model_config()[source]¶

Public accessor for the associated model configuration.

on_save(args: transformers.training_args.TrainingArguments, state: transformers.trainer_callback.TrainerState, _control: transformers.trainer_callback.TrainerControl, **_kwargs)[source]¶

Push a new revision to the hub when the checkpoint is saved.

class src.training.utils.callbacks.ReplayBufferCallback(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: TrainerCallback

Callback that pushes high-accuracy prompts into the replay buffer.

buffer_size() → int[source]¶

Return the current replay buffer size.

on_train_batch_end(args, *_unused, **kwargs)[source]¶

Inspect per-batch rewards and add successful prompts to the buffer.

class src.training.utils.callbacks.SuccessCachingCallback(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: TrainerCallback

Scrapes trainer._textual_logs after every log step and pushes any prompt whose accuracy ≥ acc_threshold into ReplayBuffer.

NOTE: Transformers never passes trainer via **kwargs; use set_trainer() instead.

on_log(_args: transformers.training_args.TrainingArguments, _state: transformers.trainer_callback.TrainerState, _control: transformers.trainer_callback.TrainerControl, _logs: dict[str, float] | None = None, **_kwargs)[source]¶

Scrape textual logs and cache successful prompts into the buffer.

set_trainer(trainer)[source]¶

Register the underlying Trainer instance.

src.training.utils.callbacks.get_callbacks(train_cfg, model_cfg, *, replay_buffer: ReplayBuffer | None = None, tokenizer=None)[source]¶

Build the callbacks requested in train_cfg.callbacks.

src.training.utils.data module¶

Dataset loading utilities for SFT training.

src.training.utils.data.get_dataset(args: ScriptArguments) → Any[source]¶

Load a dataset or a mixture of datasets based on the configuration.

Parameters:

args – Script arguments containing dataset configuration, including either a single dataset_name or a dataset_mixture definition.

Returns:

The loaded dataset object, or a mapping such as {"train": ds} when a train/test split is created.

Raises:

ValueError – If neither dataset_name nor dataset_mixture is set, or if a mixture configuration fails to load any datasets.

src.training.utils.evaluation module¶

Helpers for registering and running LightEval benchmarks via Slurm/vLLM.

src.training.utils.evaluation.get_lighteval_tasks()[source]¶

Return the list of registered LightEval task names.

src.training.utils.evaluation.register_lighteval_task(configs: Dict[str, str], eval_suite: str, task_name: str, task_list: str, num_fewshot: int = 0)[source]¶

Register a LightEval task configuration.

  • Core tasks can be added from this table: https://github.com/huggingface/lighteval/blob/main/src/lighteval/tasks/tasks_table.jsonl

  • Custom tasks that require their own metrics / scripts should live in scripts/evaluation/extended_lighteval_tasks.

Parameters:

  • configs (Dict[str, str]) – The dictionary to store the task configuration.

  • eval_suite (str) – The evaluation suite.

  • task_name (str) – The name of the task.

  • task_list (str) – The comma-separated list of tasks in the format extended|{task_name}|{num_fewshot}|0 or lighteval|{task_name}|{num_fewshot}|0.

  • num_fewshot (int, optional) – The number of few-shot examples.

src.training.utils.evaluation.run_benchmark_jobs(training_args: SFTConfig | GRPOConfig, model_args: ModelConfig) → None[source]¶

Launch all requested benchmarks for a trained model.

src.training.utils.evaluation.run_lighteval_job(benchmark: str, training_args: SFTConfig | GRPOConfig, model_args: ModelConfig) → None[source]¶

Submit a single LightEval benchmark job via Slurm/vLLM.

src.training.utils.hierarchical_grpo_dependencies module¶

Optional dependency handling for hierarchical GRPO training.

src.training.utils.hierarchical_grpo_dependencies.canonicalize_device(device: Any) → Any[source]¶

Convert accelerator-style device objects into something torch accepts.

Torch APIs expect torch.device (or a string). Accelerate sometimes provides a SimpleNamespace with a type attribute, which causes type errors when passed through directly. This helper strips out the type or wraps it in torch.device when available.

src.training.utils.hierarchical_grpo_dependencies.is_flash_attn_2_available()[source]¶
src.training.utils.hierarchical_grpo_dependencies.resolve_dependency(instance: Any, name: str, default: Any)[source]¶

Return an attribute from instance if present, otherwise default.

This helper avoids cross-module imports when hierarchical trainer mixins need to fall back to attributes supplied by the trainer.

src.training.utils.hierarchical_grpo_trainer.canonicalize_device(device: Any) → Any[source]¶

Convert accelerator-style device objects into something torch accepts.

Torch APIs expect torch.device (or a string). Accelerate sometimes provides a SimpleNamespace with a type attribute, which causes type errors when passed through directly. This helper strips out the type or wraps it in torch.device when available.

Expose textual logs via a public attribute for callbacks.

class src.training.utils.hierarchical_rollout.HierarchicalRollout(model: transformers.generation.utils.GenerationMixin, tokenizer: PreTrainedTokenizerBase, vllm_client: Any | None = None, max_reason_tokens: int = 800)[source]¶

Bases: object

Two-stage generation:

  1. Generate until </think> (or first <answer>), append the tags.

  2. Feed that full sequence back in to finish the answer.

generate(input_ids: Tensor, max_new_tokens: int | None = None, **gen_kwargs) → Tuple[Tensor, Tensor][source]¶

Generate completions using the two-stage hierarchical rollout.

get_tag_ids() → Tuple[list[int], list[int]][source]¶

Return the token ids used to detect </think> and <answer> tags.

src.training.utils.hub module¶

Lightweight helpers for interacting with the Hugging Face Hub.

src.training.utils.hub.check_hub_revision_exists(training_args: SFTConfig | GRPOConfig)[source]¶

Checks if a given Hub revision exists.

src.training.utils.hub.get_gpu_count_for_vllm(model_name: str, revision: str = 'main', num_gpus: int = 8) → int[source]¶

Choose a vLLM GPU count compatible with the model.

vLLM requires both num_attention_heads and 64 to be divisible by num_gpus; this routine decreases num_gpus until that holds.

src.training.utils.hub.get_param_count_from_repo_id(repo_id: str) → int[source]¶

Infer parameter count for a model repo.

Tries safetensors metadata first, then patterns like 42m, 1.5b or products such as 8x7b in the repo ID when metadata is unavailable.

src.training.utils.hub.push_to_hub_revision(training_args: SFTConfig | GRPOConfig, extra_ignore_patterns: list[str] | None = None) → Future[source]¶

Pushes the model to branch on a Hub repo.

src.training.utils.model_utils module¶

Helpers for constructing models and tokenizers for training.

src.training.utils.model_utils.get_model(model_args: ModelConfig, training_args: SFTConfig | GRPOConfig) → AutoModelForCausalLM[source]¶

Instantiate and return the causal LM model.

src.training.utils.model_utils.get_tokenizer(model_args: ModelConfig, training_args: SFTConfig | GRPOConfig) → PreTrainedTokenizer[source]¶

Return a tokenizer configured for the given model and training args.

src.training.utils.replay_buffer module¶

Simple replay buffer used for GRPO-style training.

class src.training.utils.replay_buffer.ReplayBuffer(capacity: int = 4000, ucb_coefficient: float = 1.0, debug_steps: int = 0, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

Bandit / UCB replay buffer with stable UIDs and optional exploit/explore mixing.

  • add_group(…) -> uid (>=0) on success, -1 on failure

  • sample_uid(…) returns a uid you can feed back into trainer._inject_one_replay_group

  • update_priority_by_uid updates μ / priority using a stable uid (safe for DDP)

add(sample: Any, reward: float) → tuple[bool, int][source]¶

Add (sample, reward). If full, replace the worst-μ entry only if reward is higher. Returns (inserted?, uid). On failure, returns (False, -1).

add_group(group: List[dict[str, Any]], reward: float | None = None, *, verbose: bool = False) → int[source]¶

Store a group (list) of examples under a single uid. Returns the uid (or the same uid if it was deduped and not inserted).

property capacity: int¶

Maximum number of entries the buffer can hold.

debug_state()[source]¶

Return a small debug snapshot of the buffer tail and metadata.

property debug_steps: int¶

Verbosity level controlling optional debug prints.

get_group(uid: int) → List[dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Return the stored group for a uid, or [] if missing.

last_error()[source]¶

Return the last error metadata recorded during insertion.

sample(batch_size: int = 1) → Tuple[List[Any], List[int], List[int], ndarray][source]¶

Uniformly sample batch_size distinct entries from the buffer.

  • Ignores μ, n, C, and mix_exploit_ratio.

  • Still returns (samples, idxs, uids, isw) so the rest of your training loop remains untouched. isw stays all‑ones.

sample_uid(*_, **__) → int | None[source]¶

Convenience: return a single UID chosen uniformly at random.

property ucb_coefficient: float¶

Exploration coefficient used for UCB-style sampling (if enabled).

update_priority(idx: int, reward: float)[source]¶

Update running priority statistics using a raw buffer index.

update_priority_by_uid(uid: int, reward: float)[source]¶

Update running priority statistics for a given uid.

src.training.utils.replay_dataset module¶

Replay-aware dataset and collate helpers used during GRPO training.

class src.training.utils.replay_dataset.ReplayMixDataset(base_dataset: Iterable[Mapping[str, Any]], tokenizer: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

Thin wrapper that tracks is_replay on items from a base dataset.

src.training.utils.replay_dataset.replay_collate(batch: List[Mapping[str, Any]], *, _replay_buffer: Any, _replay_prob: float) → List[Mapping[str, Any]][source]¶

Identity collate — no sampling here.

We only want to clear the old is_replay flag, but we must not drop ‘accuracy’.

src.training.utils.vllm_patch module¶

Helpers for talking to an external trl vllm-serve instance.

vLLM ≤ 0.8.5 returns token IDs by default:

{“completion_ids”: [[ids…]], “prompt_ids”: [[ids…]]}

This helper now detects that schema and decodes it if a tokenizer is passed.

class src.training.utils.vllm_patch.VLLMGenerateConfig(url: str = 'http://localhost:8000/generate', params: ~src.training.utils.vllm_patch.VLLMGenerationParams = <factory>, retry: ~src.training.utils.vllm_patch.VLLMRetryConfig = <factory>, tokenizer: ~typing.Any | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration for a vLLM /generate request.

The defaults mirror the legacy keyword arguments that were previously exposed on safe_generate().

params: VLLMGenerationParams¶
retry: VLLMRetryConfig¶
to_payload(prompts: List[str]) → dict[source]¶

Build the JSON payload expected by vLLM.

tokenizer: Any | None = None¶
url: str = 'http://localhost:8000/generate'¶
class src.training.utils.vllm_patch.VLLMGenerationParams(max_tokens: int = 256, temperature: float = 0.7, top_p: float = 0.9, n: int = 1, stream: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Payload parameters for a vLLM /generate request.

max_tokens: int = 256¶
n: int = 1¶
stream: bool = False¶
temperature: float = 0.7¶
top_p: float = 0.9¶
class src.training.utils.vllm_patch.VLLMRetryConfig(max_retries: int = 3, backoff: float = 1.0, timeout: float = 30.0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Retry/backoff configuration for a vLLM request.

backoff: float = 1.0¶
max_retries: int = 3¶
timeout: float = 30.0¶
src.training.utils.vllm_patch.safe_generate(prompts: List[str], config: VLLMGenerateConfig | None = None, **overrides: Any) → List[List[str]][source]¶

Robust call to /generate with retry + schema-agnostic decoding.

Use config to control request behavior; individual fields can be overridden via keyword arguments for convenience (e.g., top_p=0.8).

src.training.utils.vllm_patch.safe_request(url: str, max_retries: int = 3, backoff: float = 1.0, timeout: float = 10.0) → dict[source]¶

Perform a GET request with simple retry and exponential backoff.

src.training.utils.wandb_logging module¶

Utilities for configuring Weights & Biases logging.

src.training.utils.wandb_logging.init_wandb_training(training_args)[source]¶

Configure environment variables for Weights & Biases runs.

Expects training_args to provide wandb_entity, wandb_project, and wandb_run_group attributes (all optional).

Module contents¶

Convenience re-exports for training utility helpers.

src.training.utils.get_dataset(args: ScriptArguments) → Any[source]¶

Load a dataset or a mixture of datasets based on the configuration.

Parameters:

args – Script arguments containing dataset configuration, including either a single dataset_name or a dataset_mixture definition.

Returns:

The loaded dataset object, or a mapping such as {"train": ds} when a train/test split is created.

Raises:

ValueError – If neither dataset_name nor dataset_mixture is set, or if a mixture configuration fails to load any datasets.

Instantiate and return the causal LM model.
